roadmapItems.title: Statistics & Probability
roadmapItems.summary: Build a strong foundation in statistical concepts, probability distributions, hypothesis testing, and descriptive statistics essential for ML.

questions.title: Central Tendency Measures
questions.summary: Calculate and interpret mean, median, mode for different data distributions and understand when to use each measure.

questions.title: Normal Distribution Properties
questions.summary: Understand the 68-95-99.7 rule, z-scores, and how to work with standard normal distribution in ML contexts.

questions.title: Hypothesis Testing
questions.summary: Perform t-tests, chi-square tests, and ANOVA. Understand p-values, confidence intervals, and statistical significance.

questions.title: Bayes' Theorem
questions.summary: Apply Bayes' theorem for conditional probability calculations and understand its role in Naive Bayes classifier.

questions.title: Correlation vs Causation
questions.summary: Distinguish between correlation and causation, calculate Pearson and Spearman correlation coefficients.

roadmapItems.title: Linear Algebra
roadmapItems.summary: Master vectors, matrices, eigenvalues, and linear transformations that form the mathematical backbone of machine learning algorithms.

questions.title: Matrix Operations
questions.summary: Perform matrix multiplication, addition, transpose, and inverse operations essential for ML computations.

questions.title: Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors
questions.summary: Calculate eigenvalues and eigenvectors, understand their geometric interpretation and role in PCA.

questions.title: Vector Spaces and Norms
questions.summary: Understand vector spaces, linear independence, basis vectors, and different types of norms (L1, L2).

questions.title: Singular Value Decomposition
questions.summary: Apply SVD for dimensionality reduction, matrix factorization, and understanding recommender systems.

roadmapItems.title: Supervised Learning
roadmapItems.summary: Learn classification and regression algorithms including linear models, decision trees, ensemble methods, and SVM.

questions.title: Linear Regression
questions.summary: Implement linear regression from scratch, understand gradient descent, and interpret coefficients and R-squared.

questions.title: Logistic Regression
questions.summary: Build binary and multiclass classifiers using logistic regression, understand sigmoid function and odds ratios.

questions.title: Decision Trees
questions.summary: Construct decision trees using entropy and Gini impurity, handle overfitting with pruning techniques.

questions.title: Random Forest
questions.summary: Implement ensemble learning with random forests, understand bagging and feature importance selection.

questions.title: Support Vector Machines
questions.summary: Apply SVM for classification and regression, understand kernel trick and margin optimization.

questions.title: Naive Bayes Classifier
questions.summary: Build probabilistic classifiers using Gaussian, Multinomial, and Bernoulli Naive Bayes variants.

roadmapItems.title: Unsupervised Learning
roadmapItems.summary: Explore clustering algorithms, dimensionality reduction techniques, and association rule mining for pattern discovery.

questions.title: K-Means Clustering
questions.summary: Implement k-means algorithm, choose optimal k using elbow method and silhouette analysis.

questions.title: Hierarchical Clustering
questions.summary: Perform agglomerative and divisive clustering, interpret dendrograms and linkage criteria.

questions.title: Principal Component Analysis
questions.summary: Reduce dimensionality using PCA, understand explained variance and component interpretation.

questions.title: t-SNE Visualization
questions.summary: Apply t-SNE for high-dimensional data visualization, understand perplexity parameter tuning.

questions.title: DBSCAN Clustering
questions.summary: Implement density-based clustering to find arbitrary shaped clusters and handle noise points.

questions.title: Association Rules
questions.summary: Mine frequent itemsets using Apriori algorithm, calculate support, confidence, and lift metrics.

roadmapItems.title: Deep Learning
roadmapItems.summary: Dive into neural networks, backpropagation, CNNs, RNNs, and modern architectures like Transformers and GANs.

questions.title: Single Layer Perceptron
questions.summary: Build a basic perceptron from scratch, understand linear separability limitations and activation functions.

questions.title: Multi-layer Perceptron
questions.summary: Implement feedforward neural networks with hidden layers, understand universal approximation theorem.

questions.title: Backpropagation Algorithm
questions.summary: Derive and implement backpropagation for gradient computation, understand chain rule application.

questions.title: Convolutional Neural Networks
questions.summary: Build CNNs for image classification, understand convolution, pooling, and feature map concepts.

questions.title: Recurrent Neural Networks
questions.summary: Implement RNNs and LSTMs for sequence modeling, handle vanishing gradient problem.

questions.title: Attention Mechanisms
questions.summary: Understand self-attention and transformer architecture, implement attention from scratch.

roadmapItems.title: Model Evaluation & Validation
roadmapItems.summary: Learn cross-validation, performance metrics, bias-variance tradeoff, and techniques to prevent overfitting.

questions.title: Train-Test-Validation Split
questions.summary: Properly split datasets, understand data leakage prevention and stratified sampling techniques.

questions.title: Cross-Validation Techniques
questions.summary: Implement k-fold, stratified, and time series cross-validation for robust model evaluation.

questions.title: Classification Metrics
questions.summary: Calculate precision, recall, F1-score, ROC-AUC, and understand confusion matrix interpretation.

questions.title: Regression Metrics
questions.summary: Apply MAE, MSE, RMSE, and R-squared for regression model evaluation and comparison.

questions.title: Bias-Variance Tradeoff
questions.summary: Understand bias-variance decomposition, identify overfitting/underfitting, and apply regularization.

questions.title: Hyperparameter Tuning
questions.summary: Optimize models using grid search, random search, and Bayesian optimization techniques.

roadmapItems.title: Feature Engineering
roadmapItems.summary: Master data preprocessing, feature selection, creation, and transformation techniques to improve model performance.

questions.title: Missing Data Handling
questions.summary: Apply imputation techniques including mean, median, mode, KNN, and multiple imputation methods.

questions.title: Categorical Data Encoding
questions.summary: Implement one-hot encoding, label encoding, target encoding, and binary encoding for categorical variables.

questions.title: Feature Scaling
questions.summary: Apply standardization, normalization, and robust scaling to handle different feature scales.

questions.title: Feature Selection
questions.summary: Use filter, wrapper, and embedded methods for feature selection including RFE and LASSO.

questions.title: Polynomial Features
questions.summary: Create polynomial and interaction features to capture non-linear relationships in data.

questions.title: Text Feature Engineering
questions.summary: Apply TF-IDF, bag of words, n-grams, and word embeddings for text data preprocessing.

roadmapItems.title: Time Series Analysis
roadmapItems.summary: Learn forecasting techniques, seasonality detection, ARIMA models, and deep learning approaches for temporal data.

questions.title: Time Series Components
questions.summary: Decompose time series into trend, seasonality, and residual components using STL decomposition.

questions.title: Stationarity Testing
questions.summary: Test for stationarity using ADF test and make series stationary through differencing and transformations.

questions.title: ARIMA Modeling
questions.summary: Build ARIMA models for forecasting, determine optimal p, d, q parameters using ACF and PACF plots.

questions.title: Seasonal ARIMA
questions.summary: Implement SARIMA models for seasonal time series, handle multiple seasonality patterns.

questions.title: LSTM for Time Series
questions.summary: Apply LSTM neural networks for time series forecasting, handle sequence-to-sequence problems.
